Description: The action that created this this Entity
HuBMAP id generated at the same time as and associated directly with the UUID for the Entity.  This ID can be used when registering an object with the DOI System.
The entity type. Allowable values here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1L8mfs767Z5ZGnZ92UJySlHxprraSariH1dU45g6jphE/edit

HuBMAP id used internal to the Consortium, generated at the same time as and associated directly with the UUID for the Entity.  The id is built on the the id from the parent object.  Format explained here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DjHgmqWF1VA5-3mfzLFNfabbzmc8KLSG9xWx1DDLlzo/
The data/time when the entity was created
Location information of where the tissue sample came from in the organ that the tissue was sourced from.  Specified in JSON, as outputed from the RUI tool.
An id specific to the lab where the tissue was processed.
The HuBMAP auto-generated UUID for the Entity
An array of data/assay types contained in the Dataset.  Allowable values here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1L8mfs767Z5ZGnZ92UJySlHxprraSariH1dU45g6jphE/edit
A description of the Entity, hand entered into the UI

Metadata associated with the Entity. Formated in JSON. Donor metadata is transformed from files uploaded into the Ingest UI.  Sample metadata will be transformed from files uploaded into the Ingest UI.  Dataset metadata will be transformed from the HIVE specified .tsv file provided with data uploads and/or extraction from data or metadata files provided in the data upload.
An array of information about the files contained in the dataset.
An array of information about image files uploaded during donor or tissue registration via the Tissue Registration UI
An donor id specific to the lab where the tissue was procured.
A lab specific label/name assigned to a donor by the lab during registration of the donor.
An array of information about metadata files uploaded via the Tissue Registration UI
The name of a dataset as entered into the Ingest UI
The organ type when specimen_type == organ.  Allowable values here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1L8mfs767Z5ZGnZ92UJySlHxprraSariH1dU45g6jphE/edit
If organ type == other, the organ name is specified in this field
true if the data contains human gene sequence information, false otherwise
The url to the protocols.io instance describing donor selection criteria, tissue procurement protocols and or data generation/derivation details.
An array of information about files uploaded through the Donor/Tissue Registration UI donor selection criteria or tissue procurement protocols.
The name of the lab/TMC/TTD/RTI where the Entity was registered.
A UUID associated with the lab/TMC/TTD/RTI where the Entity was registered.
The date/time when the entity was last updatedl
The name of the person who registered/created the Entity.
The email address of the person who registerd/created the Entity.
For Sample entities, the type of tissue specimen.  Allowable values here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1L8mfs767Z5ZGnZ92UJySlHxprraSariH1dU45g6jphE/edit
If specimen_type == other, the specimen type name is specified in this field
The status of a Dataset. Allowable values listed here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1L8mfs767Z5ZGnZ92UJySlHxprraSariH1dU45g6jphE/edit
The clinical visit specifier of when a piece of tissue was procured.  This is hand entered via the Tissue Registration UI at the time of tissue registration.
The ancestor Donor at the top of the provenance chain for the Entity.  This contains, in JSON, the full Entity information for the Donor.
The tissue sample directly below Donor (should usually be an organ) at the top of the provenance chain for the Entity. This conntains, in JSON, the full Entity information for the Sample.
The tissue sample or samples that the data was directly derived from.  This contains, in JSON, the full Entity information for the Sample.
